prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will establish the origin and orientation of the part. Next, create the 2D sketch for the base of the prism. Draw a rectangle on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. The rectangle should have four lines, with the following start and end points: 1. Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] 2. Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.75] 3. Line 3: [0.75, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] 4. Line 4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch\\_scale scaling parameter. This will reduce the overall size of the prism. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. This will position the sketch in 3D space, ready for extrusion. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal to 0.003 and the extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal to 0.0. This will create a prism with a height of 0.003 units, extruded in the positive Z direction. The resulting prism will have dimensions of 0.75 units by 0.75 units by 0.003 units. For this part, the length is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.003 units. Final Shape: A three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 0.75 units by 0.75 units by 0.003 units. Part 2: Combine the prism with another part To combine the prism with another part, use the appropriate boolean operation to integrate the prism with the preceding CAD models. The operation can be one of the following: CutFeatureOperation, IntersectFeatureOperation, JoinFeatureOperation, or NewBodyFeatureOperation. In each case, you should describe the intent of the operation, without using the specific terms. For example, if the operation is a JoinFeatureOperation, you would say "Add the prism to the existing CAD models". The junior CAD designer should then be able to infer the correct boolean operation based on your description. For the final shape, the height is 4 units, the width is 3 units, and the length is 2 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4412, 0.0] Step 2: Create the first face of the part Create a new face at the XY plane of the coordinate system and draw a loop consisting of 4 lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1103] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1103], End Point [0.0, 0.1103] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1103], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Extrude the sketch to create the 3D model Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by a distance of 0.4412 units. Part 2: Construct a smaller rectangular prism joined to the previous part. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1985, 0.4412, 0.0] Step 2: Create the first face of the part Create a new face at the XY plane of the coordinate system and draw a loop consisting of 4 lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1654, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1654, 0.0], End Point [0.1654, 0.1103] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1654, 0.1103], End Point [0.0, 0.1103] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1103], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1654. Step 4: Extrude the sketch to create the 3D model Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by a distance of 0.0441 units, joining it to the previous part. The result is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, formed by joining two smaller rectangular prisms.</description>
